snippet: California has approved a plan to give gay and lesbian parents the same tax benefits accorded to unmarried heterosexuals with children.    The 3-to-2 decision by the state's Board of Equalization, announced this week, made California the first sta...
lead_paragraph: California has approved a plan to give gay and lesbian parents the same tax benefits accorded to unmarried heterosexuals with children. The 3-to-2 decision by the state's Board of Equalization, announced this week, made California the first state to explicitly recognize that, for tax purposes, gay men and lesbians can be considered parents of children not biologically their own.
abstract: California approves plan to give gay and lesbian parents same tax benefits accorded to unmarried heterosexuals with children; case involves woman who sought to claim same 'head of household' tax status accorded to unmarried heterosexual couples with children (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; California Recognizes Tax Right of Gay Parents
